definition: Kangxi radical 61 (心) as a vertical side element
to feel dizzy/to be confused/to be at a loss/to stare blankly/Taiwan pr. [fa1 meng2]
see 聰明一世，糊塗一時|聪明一世，糊涂一时[cong1 ming5 yi1 shi4 , hu2 tu5 yi1 shi2]
pinyin: cong1 ming5 yi1 shi4 , meng3 dong3 yi1 shi2

sentences.english: The sheer time all this must have required boggled Hutton's mind.
sentences.chinese: 這一切的純粹時間一定把赫頓搞懵了。

sentences.english: “We were totally blown away at the emphasis parents were placing ontheir children, ” she says.
sentences.chinese: 面對父母強加給孩子的重要性，我們完全懵了。
這問題把他完全搞懵了。

sentences.english: He had never met this type of question before and was suddenly baffled.
sentences.chinese: 他從未見過這種題型，一下子懵了。

sentences.english: I first know him from one of his papers that my current advisor recommmend me.
sentences.chinese: 我懵了一下想難道是問我認識不認識我未來的導師？

sentences.english: The ancient wild be fierce attack hit meng, he ordered his men try very hard to resist.
sentences.chinese: 古野被猛烈的攻擊打懵了，他命令手下拼命抵抗。

definition: to feel dizzy/to be confused/to be at a loss/to stare blankly/Taiwan pr. [fa1 meng2]
not knowing what to do (idiom); at one's wits' end/embarrassed and at a complete loss
to be unable to make any sense of the matter/to be at a loss
(Internet slang) nothing left to live for
lit. not to know whether to laugh or cry (idiom)/both funny and extremely embarrassing/between laughter and tears
